conclusion: Determine if Car A is ahead or behind Car B at t = 10 seconds by comparing distances traveled.
Distance traveled is the area under the velocity-time graph.
Car A accelerates uniformly from 0 to 40 m/s from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
Area under Car A's graph from t = 0 to t = 10 is a right triangle.
Car B accelerates uniformly at a different rate from t = 0 to t = 10 seconds.
Area under Car B's graph from t = 0 to t = 10 is a right triangle.
Car B reaches 40 m/s at t = 20 seconds, slope is 2 m/sÂ².
At t = 10 seconds, Car B's velocity is 20 m/s.
Compare distances: Car A traveled 200 meters, Car B traveled 100 meters.
Car A is ahead of Car B by 100 meters at t = 10 seconds.
Final answer: At t = 10 seconds, Car A is ahead of Car B.
